intro: Canthium socotranum, commonly known as Socotra caper, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to the arid and rocky environment of its native habitat. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Canthium socotranum is also notable for its unique leaf structure, which helps reduce water loss in its harsh climate.
